speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: Anthony LaPaglia  * * *  ##  Transcript {david langley}     _Act 1  Scene 1 - The Parking Garage  Fade in.  Frasier pulls his BMW into his parking space.  Just after, Cam Winston pulls his HMMV into the spot to his left.  Frasier opens his door, but it can only swing about six inches.  Cam gets out of his car._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me.  Cam?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Cam
text: Oh, hello Frasier.  Still driving a sedan?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, at least mine fits in the allotted space.  Unlike this new... behemoth you're driving.

speaker: Cam
text: Actually, it's the new Behemoth XL.  Well, use care getting out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come back here!  You know very well I can't get out!

speaker: Cam
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Let me see what I can do about that. _He walks back to the driver's side of his car as Frasier pushes his head up through his sun roof._

speaker: Cam
text: Oh, tough break.  If I move I'll be over the line on the other side.

speaker: Frasier
text: But you're over the line on this side.

speaker: Cam
text: Actually, if you were standing out here, you would see that I'm just on the line, which, as we both know, is in.

speaker: Frasier
text: If I were standing out there, we wouldn't be having this conversation!

speaker: Cam
text: I wish I could help.  Maybe next time you'll think twice before calling the police when I have a party.

speaker: Frasier
text: What makes you think it was me?

speaker: Cam
text: You're the only one in the building I didn't invite. _He clicks his car alarm and leaves.  Frasier, grunting, pulls himself up through the sun roof to sit on the roof of his car.  He pulls his hands up, worried about the finish, takes off his shoes and tosses them to the floor, then tries to ease down the back of his car.  Slipping, he grabs at the pipe above his car, pulling it loose and pouring water over and into his car and himself.  FADE OUT_ [_N.B. Though Cam Winston, and the details of the feud described above, appear first in Season Seven's[[7.11]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_11/the_fight_before_christmas_2.html "The Fight Before Christmas \[2\]") "The Fight Before Christmas," this is the first time we see him in the flesh._]  _Scene 2 - Niles' Apartment at the Montana  Fade in.  Daphne comes in the front door, pulling a small rolling suitcase.  Roz is with her._

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks again for the ride, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Sure, no problem.  Isn't this a lot of stuff for just one night?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's not for one night.  Niles and I have decided to keep a few things at each other's houses.  You know, save running back and forth. _Niles comes in, pulling a bellman's dolly, with several suitcases and garment bags on it._

speaker: Niles
text: There you are.  I thought I heard you come in.  Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: My God, what is all that?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's just the stuff I'm gonna be keeping at your place. Oh, Roz, since you're here, do you mind giving me a ride?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, what's wrong with your car?

speaker: Niles
text: I had to lend it to Frasier, his is drying out.  Long story.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I don't think I'm gonna be able to get all that stuff in my car.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well I'm sure once we get the rest of Daphne's stuff out, there'll be plenty of room.

speaker: Daphne
text: These are all my things.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, uh... I guess I can do with out this dressing gown.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, but, what if I'm wearing dark pajamas?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, that would be all crazy.  Niles, maybe if I take the back seat out of my car, I can cram all this stuff in.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, that might work, but let's not move anything until Niles and I have had a little discussion about this.

speaker: Niles
text: Um, well, I definitely know I'm gonna need this one.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll take it down.  Niles, what do you have in here?

speaker: Niles
text: Um... ties.

speaker: Niles
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Daphne
text: Where are we supposed to put all this?  I cleared out two drawers.  This'll fill two closets!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we said we'd both bring whatever we needed for any eventuality.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, isn't there anything you can leave behind?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't see how, I have formal, semi-formal, dishabille, wet weather, cold weather, cloudy.  I mean, if there's something here you find excessive, jump right in.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just don't have the space, and I don't see your brother giving up any of his.  Maybe this isn't going to work.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I just thought this would make things easier.

speaker: Daphne
text: And it would, if I had more room.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you're right.  It was thoughtless of me.  I guess I'm just used to rattling around here all by myself.  Sometimes I think this is too much space for just one person.

speaker: Niles
text: You know...

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: You could live here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you asking me?

speaker: Niles
text: Would you like to?

speaker: Daphne
text: Would you like me to?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: Then I will.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay.

speaker: Niles
text: Wow!  That was a big thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll say.  I'm gonna live in your apartment!

speaker: Niles
text: OUR apartment.

speaker: Daphne
text: Our apartment.  Oh, my, I'm gonna have to practice saying that.  "Let's go back to our apartment."

speaker: Niles
text: "Why don't we meet at our apartment?"

speaker: Daphne
text: "Oh, my, our apartment has a gas leak."

speaker: Niles
text: "Oh, no!  Our apartment's going to explode!"

speaker: Daphne
text: "Oh, no!  There goes our apartment." _They break up laughing and Daphne pushes at him, knocking him to the floor.  Roz comes in._

speaker: Roz
text: So, what else are we taking?

speaker: Daphne
text: Good news, Roz, Niles and I are moving in together.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey, that's great news!  So I didn't have to strip two bolts and grease up my shirt moving the seat out after all.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nope.  And you didn't need to take Niles' ties down, either.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  But I will get the ties.  You stay here in our apartment.

speaker: Daphne
text: OUR apartment.  Our living room, our fireplace...

speaker: Niles
text: Our kitchen.  Our bedroom.

speaker: Daphne
text: Our bedroom...

speaker: Roz
text: I'll get the ties. _She leaves.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Frasier comes in, drops his keys on the side table and stands smugly for a moment._

speaker: Frasier
text: You should have been at the condo board meeting, Dad, you missed all the excitement.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't tell me, people argued about some dumb building policy, then you all had cookies.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not this time.  I gave the greatest speech of my condo board career, which led to a vote, which led to the ruling that Cam Winston must now park that SUV monstrosity of his in the SUB- basement!  Then we had cookies.

speaker: Martin
text: My mistake.  How did Cam take it?

speaker: Frasier
text: He was livid, thank you.  But I pointed out that the emissions from his oversized vehicle endangered the health of anyone passing through the lobby, and I won the day.

speaker: Martin
text: People bought that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I am an orator.  It is not only that which is said, but the passion with which it is said.

speaker: Martin
text: You're saying it now and it just sounds like a lot of hooey.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's because I'm not orating right now.  Oh, just go back to your paper!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, good afternoon again, Cam.

speaker: Cam
text: Listen, Crane, you may have bamboozled the condo board, but we both know you just want more room to swing your fat ass into that BMW.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cam, if there is any benefit to me, it is the cleaner air which we will all now breath.

speaker: Cam
text: Oh, get off your high horse.  You do your share of polluting with that substitute for masculinity you're driving.

speaker: Frasier
text: If mine's a "substitute for masculinity", then what is yours?

speaker: Cam
text: Bigger!

speaker: Martin
text: Ha!

speaker: Frasier
text: That wasn't funny.  I'm sorry, Cam, but I believe the issue is closed.  It was voted on by the majority.  In the spirit of the great democracy that is America, I believe that is check and mate.  Good day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Boo-hoo, Cam, no more blocking my driver's side door.

speaker: Martin
text: Do you think that's smart?  Ticking off the guy who lives right above us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, we are protected by this building's constitution. Believe me, I will have Cam cited for a noise violation if he so much as drops a hint!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, hello, I'm glad you're both here.  We have news.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm moving in with Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that is a big decision.  My goodness, congratulations.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, wow, it's not gonna be the same around here without you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't worry, I'll still be around plenty, even if I'm not living here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello?  Oh, Mum.  Yeah, I'm sorry, I've been meaning to call, but Dr. Crane yells at me whenever I phone long distance.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do not!

speaker: Martin
text: Let her say whatever she needs to.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_heading to her room with the phone_] And poor old Mr. Crane is so feeble he can't even make it to the loo by himself.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!

speaker: Niles
text: Can you believe it?  I am actually going to be living under the same roof with the woman I adore.  If you had told me two years ago that this was going to happen, I would have said you were crazy.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know exactly how you feel, Niles.  You know, I used to think Cam Winston's SUV was immovable, and now look at me! [_off their looks_] Well, I think this calls for a celebration!  How about some champagne?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, stay there, I'll get the Dom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's the end of an era.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, it's been the three of us under this roof for nine years.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you remember when Daphne first came here?  She was so young and naive, I didn't think she'd last a week.  Yet she somehow managed to forge a relationship with a, a blustery psychiatrist and a crotchety old man.

speaker: Martin
text: And with me, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad, with you too.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we knew she wouldn't be around forever, but I never would've guessed she'd end up with Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.  He's come so far since the dark days of Maris and Mel.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess from now on it's just you and I.

speaker: Frasier
text: "You and me", Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sotto voce_] This is gonna be great.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Niles, when is moving day?

speaker: Niles
text: As soon as possible.  Once we'd made the decision, neither one of us wants to waste a second.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, the move is off.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: Just temporarily, my parents are coming for a visit.

speaker: Niles
text: What does that have to do with us living together?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I just think with all the confusion involved with a move, it's best to wait until after they leave.

speaker: Niles
text: Or, we could call a mover and have all your stuff over at my place tomorrow, and you parents can stay with us.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles, that is so sweet, I know they'll love that.  But I think I should wait until after their visit to move.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, what's going on?

speaker: Daphne
text: Nothing.  I just think, well, why rush?  Moving is something to be enjoyed.

speaker: Niles
text: So, just to clarify, you're going to stay here, but your parents are going to stay with me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm so glad you understand. _She hugs him.  Looking over her shoulder, he mouths "What happened?" to the others.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Niles' Apartment at the Montana  Fade in. Martin is sitting on the couch.  Niles and Frasier are setting up to greet the Moons._

speaker: Niles
text: I hope Daphne's not having trouble with their luggage. I should have gone with her to the airport.  What kind of impression does it make that I didn't go with her?

speaker: Martin
text: She didn't want you to go with her.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, what does that say?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, will you relax?  You always make a good first impression.

speaker: Niles
text: SECOND impression.  The first impression I made when I kidnapped their daughter from her wedding.  Oh God, where are my crab croquettes?

speaker: Frasier
text: I put them in the warming oven.

speaker: Niles
text: They'll dry out!

speaker: Frasier
text: Then I'll serve them.

speaker: Niles
text: No, they'll get cold!  Oh, I don't know, I don't know!

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now!  Crab croquettes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, it's show time!  Keep you wits about you.

speaker: Martin
text: Right.  I'll just follow your lead. _Niles rushes, almost knocking over a lamp but catching it, then opens the door to Daphne and her mother._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Mrs. Moon, welcome, come in.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, you remember Niles?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Of course.  You know, I was quite cross with you when you stole my daughter away from that rich lawyer.  But from the looks of this place, you do all right.

speaker: Martin
text: Nice to see you again, Mrs. Moon.  Martin Crane.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, of course, you're the one who's kind enough to keep my daughter employed.

speaker: Martin
text: It's not kindness, she does a great job.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Well, she does what she can with what God gave her.

speaker: Niles
text: Um, where's Mr. Moon?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, actually, there's been a slight change of plans...

speaker: Simon
text: 'Allo, 'allo.

speaker: Niles
text: Simon!

speaker: Frasier
text: Simon!

speaker: Martin
text: Buddy, how ya doin'?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, I'm thirsty for starts.

speaker: Martin
text: Then let's take care of that!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, I could use a tiny nip of something myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is your brother doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Me dad couldn't make it, so Mum brought him instead.

speaker: Niles
text: Why, why didn't your dad come?

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't know.  I'm disappointed, but I'm not surprised.  Dad doesn't like to travel.

speaker: Niles
text: Why not?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: You know, that flight made my feet swell up like a couple of Christmas hams.  Simon, give 'em a rub.

speaker: Simon
text: I rubbed 'em halfway across the Atlantic.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras, I've got an idea: Why doesn't Simon stay with us?

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, that's very kind of you, Marty.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well it is, except that, well I think there'll be more room right here at Niles'.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, although Frasier's apartment is closer to a pizza restaurant.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but Niles' is closer to a liquor mart.

speaker: Simon
text: Now, now, now I don't want you boys fightin' over me.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, how many channels does that satellite of yours get?

speaker: Martin
text: Five hundred.

speaker: Simon
text: We have a winner!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, your room's gonna be down that hallway on the left, if you'd like to freshen up.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, look who's the lady of the house.  Spend a lot of time here, do you?

speaker: Simon
text: Are you kidding?  She's probably had it off in every room.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Simon Moon, bite your tongue!  My baby girl's a virgin. Isn't that so, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course, Mum.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: It's you that'll have your leg over any filth that moves.

speaker: Simon
text: I don't care if they're moving. [_N.B. Mrs. Moon's insistence that Daphne is still a virgin does not jibe with her easily believing Daphne was pregnant in_[[7.24]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_24/something_borrowed_someone_blue_2.html "Something Borrowed, Someone Blue \[2\]"),_"Something Borrowed, Someone Blue."_]

speaker: Niles
text: Um, Daphne, can I see you in the kitchen for just a sec? Excuse me.

speaker: Simon
text: Should we stop at the supermarket on the way home?  I'm very fond of those "Ham and Cheese Hot Pockets" that you had last year.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I keep those stocked.  Everything's just like you remember.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there has been one small change: the liquor cabinet has a lock.

speaker: Simon
text: Well, my new moped had a lock, too.

speaker: Daphne
text: My mother is very old fashioned.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if she thinks your a virgin, how are you going to explain our plan to live together?

speaker: Daphne
text: I wonder how important it is that she ever finds out.

speaker: Niles
text: What are you saying?  We're just not going to tell her?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I can still get me mail at your brother's and me phone messages, and we can screen calls here.

speaker: Niles
text: That's ridiculous, we're adults.  We're not going to sneak around like this.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not forever.  Mum's getting on in years and she smokes like a chimney.

speaker: Niles
text: Your mother really thinks you're still a virgin?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles, who cares what Mum thinks?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Fresh! _Niles looks confused and frustrated.  FADE TO:_ **3265 INSULTS AND 5 DAYS LATER...** _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Martin is in his chair, watching a game, Simon is on the couch._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you better not let Frasier see you wipe your hands on the couch.  He's mad enough that you ate that stuff he puts on his face.

speaker: Simon
text: [_pointing_] I'm telling you, it was marmalade.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you mind?  Feet off the furniture.

speaker: Simon
text: You heard him, Eddie, get off, go on.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's talking to you.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Daphne, dear, I've finally figured out what's wrong with your outfit: it's made for a smaller woman.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, hold on, I was there when she picked out that outfit, I think it's absolutely...

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks for dinner, Niles, it was really great.

speaker: Niles
text: You're welcome.  Well, the best is still ahead.  Wait 'til you taste the apple crisp that Daphne made for dessert.

speaker: Simon
text: Is that that delicious apple thing with crispy bits on top?

speaker: Daphne
text: We still have ice cream.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, wow, this is getting embarrassing.

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon, how could you?

speaker: Simon
text: Well, the ice cream was Marty's idea!

speaker: Martin
text: Only the first bowl!

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Daphne, don't go picking' on your brother.  I'll just have me tea.  Niles, be a dear and get me a pillow for me head.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, and I wouldn't get too settled in, you'll need to take me home soon so I can take me medicine.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought I suggested you bring that with you.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Daphne, dear, aren't you lucky to be dating a man who's always right?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll just go put the kettle on.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, I wish you'd stop bossing everyone around.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, listen to my silly girl!  If she knew how to deal with men, she'd have a husband by now. _Niles swings the pillow back as if to hit her, but fluffs it and puts it down as she turns to him._

speaker: Niles
text: Pillow for you, here you go, you just rest your head and I'll see how Frasier's doing with the kettle.

speaker: Simon
text: Rose, you're looking fit.  You know, I'd've gone too, if I'd known you were going to dinner.  I hope you've left room for afters.

speaker: Roz
text: I have a boyfriend now, Simon, so you can just lay off.

speaker: Simon
text: YOU WHAT?!  I thought you would wait for my return.  Oh, well, let's have another go then, for old time's sake.

speaker: Roz
text: We never had a go.

speaker: Simon
text: We didn't?  Who was that, then?

speaker: Niles
text: The last five days, that woman has made my life a living hell!

speaker: Frasier
text: You want to trade?  Simon put my sixty-five dollar apricot skin polish on his muffins.

speaker: Niles
text: Simon is a boor.  At least he's not cruel.  You hear the way she talks to Daphne, and Daphne just takes it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's understandable, Niles.  I mean, after all, she only sees her mother rarely.  I suppose it's just easier to bite her tongue than to engage in some kind of ugly confrontation.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, maybe so, but it's just frustrating to see Daphne so timid.  I wish she'd stand up for herself or stand up for us or I'll tell you: if she doesn't, I just might.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure she will when the time is right.  Meanwhile, they are her family and our guests.  Let's remember that.

speaker: Simon
text: [_calling from the living room_] Oi, Frasier, can I use this as an ashtray?

speaker: Frasier
text: Son of a BITCH! _He rushes out.  CUT TO: the living room where Simon is tapping his cigarette into a vase._

speaker: Frasier
text: Do NOT use that, please. [_hands her an empty can_] Here, here.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: An empty can?  I'd have thought with all your fancy dingle dangles you'd have something nicer for your guests who smoke.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well customarily my guests who smoke do so on the balcony.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: [_gets her own can_] This is lovely, thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you mind?!

speaker: Simon
text: Come on, Rose.  We both know that this boyfriend thing is a ruse.  You don't have to play hard to get with me.

speaker: Roz
text: I really do have a boyfriend.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh yeah?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Simon
text: What's his name?

speaker: Roz
text: Roger.

speaker: Simon
text: What color is his hair?

speaker: Roz
text: Brown.

speaker: Simon
text: What's his name?

speaker: Roz
text: Roger.

speaker: Simon
text: Is that the name you just said a minute ago?

speaker: Martin
text: I think Eddie could use a walk.

speaker: Roz
text: I could use one too.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, well, actually, I was just going across to the...

speaker: Roz
text: [_rushing_] Yeah, that's great, I'd love to!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I have an idea: let's have a toast.

speaker: Simon
text: Well, it's about bloody time!

speaker: Frasier
text: To my very favorite couple: Niles and Daphne.  You don't know my brother very well, Mrs. Moon, but I assure you, he and your daughter share a boundless love.  One that is sure to endure as long as that of my parents, and of yours and your husband's.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, now you've dropped a clanger.

speaker: Daphne
text: What is it, Mum?

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, tell them, son.

speaker: Simon
text: Dad scarpered.

speaker: Daphne
text: He left?

speaker: Simon
text: Yeah.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: It's true.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, I do apologize.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Mum, it can't be!  I'm sure he just got sidetracked on his way home from the pub.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Well, I thought meself for the first week, but no, he's gone for good.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, don't worry, Mum.  Everything'll be all right when we get home.

speaker: Mrs. Moon
text: Oh, what's left for me there?  An empty house full of memories?  No, I'd rather stay right here, in the company of my babies.  Thank goodness I have my children to lean upon.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, don't cry, Mum.  I really thought this junket to America would cheer you up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, it still can.  Go away!

speaker: Niles
text: I mean, get out there and see the country.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that is a splendid idea!  This land is rich with snow- covered mountains, sun-kissed beaches, wild untamed rivers and a, a warm loving people ready to embrace you.  Immerse yourself in the spectacle and the grandeur that are these United States, this America!

speaker: Niles
text: How did you do that? _Confused, Frasier turns to follow Niles' gaze.  Seeing his balcony completely blocked in, he starts.   Trembling, he puts his drink down._

speaker: Frasier
text: Cam Winston! **TO BE CONTINUED**
